bill_title: to increase the salary of legislators.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to increase the salary of legislators and to refer the question to a vote of the electors of this state at the next general election. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That the following Act be enacted by the South Dakota Legislative Assembly and referred to the vote of the electors of the state at the next general election to be held in the year 1998 for their approval: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to increase the salary of legislators. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 2-4-2 be amended to read as follows: 2-4-2. The salary of each member of the Legislature is four ten thousand two hundred sixty-seven dollars for every regular legislative session held in odd-numbered years, and three thousand seven hundred thirty-three dollars for every regular legislative session held in even-numbered years . In addition, each legislator shall receive: (1) Reimbursement to be paid after the legislative session for actual mileage or its equivalent traveled to and from home not more than once each weekend or between days of recess during the regular legislative session, at state rates established by the board of finance; (2) Expenses of ninety-five dollars per day for each day of a regular or special legislative session as prepaid reimbursement for living expenses, including meals and lodging, laundry, cleaning and pressing of clothing, and all other uncompensated expenses as defined in § 2-4-2.1 incident to the performance of legislative services; and (3) Five cents once each session for every mile of necessary travel in going to and returning from the place of meeting of the Legislature by the most usual route. For each day's attendance at special sessions each member in addition to mileage and expenses shall receive a per diem calculated by the director of the Legislative Research Council equal to the normal daily compensation for the regular session immediately preceding the special session. Section 2. The effective date of this Act is January 1, 1999.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to increase the salary of legislators. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 2-4-2 be amended to read as follows: 2-4-2. The salary of each member of the Legislature is four six thousand two hundred sixty-seven dollars for every regular legislative session held in odd-numbered years, and three thousand seven hundred thirty-three dollars for every regular legislative session held in even-numbered years . In addition, each legislator shall receive: (1) Reimbursement to be paid after the legislative session for actual mileage or its equivalent traveled to and from home not more than once each weekend or between days of recess during the regular legislative session, at state rates established by the board of finance; (2) Expenses of ninety-five dollars per day for each day of a regular or special legislative session as prepaid reimbursement for living expenses, including meals and lodging, laundry, cleaning and pressing of clothing, and all other uncompensated expenses as defined in § 2-4-2.1 incident to the performance of legislative services; and (3) Five cents once each session for every mile of necessary travel in going to and returning from the place of meeting of the Legislature by the most usual route. For each day's attendance at special sessions each member in addition to mileage and expenses shall receive a per diem calculated by the director of the Legislative Research Council equal to the normal daily compensation for the regular session immediately preceding the special session. Section 2. The effective date of this Act is January 1, 1999. BILL HISTORY 1/21/98 First read in House and referred to State Affairs. H.J. 153 1/26/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/28/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/28/98 State Affairs Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 10, NAYS 2. H.J. 271
